channel.title: where is the file in openSUSE?
channel.description: I tried to do a simple traffic isolation in this article https://www.howtoforge.com/how-to-set-up-a-tor-middlebox-routing-all-virtualbox-virtual-machine-traffic-over-the-tor-network and its comments , I installed the package "bridge-utils", in the adding the configuation items to /etc/network/interfaces, the path isn't existed in my SUSE Leap, does anybody know which configure file is similar to this?

item.title: where is the file in openSUSE?
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
Of course its difficult when you have so little RAM. Either upgrade it or buy another machine. Virtualization is resource demanding.

Read full topic
item.source: where is the file in openSUSE?

item.title: where is the file in openSUSE?
item.dc:creator: Ego
item.description:
Good day,

In that case, this has nothing to do with Whonix and we won’t be able to help you.

Have a nice day,

Ego

item.description:
I tried to do a simple traffic isolation in this article https://www.howtoforge.com/how-to-set-up-a-tor-middlebox-routing-all-virtualbox-virtual-machine-traffic-over-the-tor-network and its comments , I installed the package “bridge-utils”, in the adding the configuation items to /etc/network/interfaces, the path isn’t existed in my SUSE Leap, does anybody know which configure file is similar to this?
